definitions.definition: the tendency to become angry very quickly:

examples: The children behaved so badly that I lost my temper.

definitions.definition: to succeed in staying calm and not becoming angry:
examples: I found it hard to keep my temper with so many things going wrong.
I'd stay away from her if I were you - she's in a foul temper.
He appears to be a man of calm and even temper.

definitions.definition: to make something less strong, extreme, etc.:
examples: My enthusiasm for the venture was tempered by my knowledge of the hard work that would be involved.
